alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Coastal Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued February 01 at 2:50AM EST until February 01 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected along shorelines and tidal waterways (7.4 to 7.6 feet Mean Lower Low Water at Charleston). * WHERE...Coastal Colleton and Charleston Counties. * WHEN...From 7 AM to 10 AM EST this morning. * IMPACTS...This will result in some roads becoming impassable and minor flooding of properties. Motorists should be prepared for delays if traveling in Downtown Charleston. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide will occur around 8:03 AM today at Charleston. Saltwater inundation will be possible 1 to 2 hours before and after high tide. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Charleston Harbor SC MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 7.5 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.2 ft, Moderate 1.7 ft, Major 2.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 01/08 AM 7.5 1.7 1.0 N/A Moderate 01/08 PM 6.3 0.5 1.0 N/A None 02/09 AM 7.3 1.5 1.0 N/A Minor 02/09 PM 6.4 0.6 1.0 N/A None 03/10 AM 7.1 1.3 1.0 N/A Minor 03/10 PM 6.3 0.5 0.9 N/A None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
